fields.summary: Create a proxy chain for ResourceManager REST API in the Router

fields.description: NodeIDsInfo contains a typo and there is a missing constructor in LabelsToNodesInfo. These bugs does not allow a correct conversation in XML of  LabelsToNodesInfo.
fields.summary: Incorrect XML convertion in NodeIDsInfo and LabelsToNodesInfo

comments.body: I guess we need to add some more test cases here as well.

[~sunilg], thanks for the feedback. I agree we should increase coverage of the Info/REST parts of YARN. As none of that is currently cover by tests, I propose to deal with this more systematically (not in this minor typo-fix patch). I have opened YARN-6817 for that. Are you ok with this?

Thanks [~giovanni.fumarola]. Makes sense to me as we can have a structured set of test cases to cover this in general. I am just marking these 2 jiras linked for a better traceability.

A very minor nit. Could you place the new ctor above the getter in LabelsToNodesInfo. Barring that, I am +1 for the latest patch.

[~sunilg] thanks for the feedback - v2 addresses it.
Yetus reported 2 failed tests not related to my patch.
[~sunilg], Thanks for reviewing. Will you be committing or I can so that [~giovanni.fumarola] can be unblocked for YARN-5412.
+1. Thanks [~subru]. Yes, I will help to commit the same now.
Committed to trunk/branch-2. Thank you [~giovanni.fumarola] for the patch.

SUCCESS: Integrated in Jenkins build Hadoop-trunk-Commit #12005 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/12005/])
YARN-6792. Incorrect XML convertion in NodeIDsInfo and (sunilg: rev 228ddaa31d812533b862576445494bc2cd8a2884)
* (edit) hadoop-yarn-project/hadoop-yarn/hadoop-yarn-server/hadoop-yarn-server-resourcemanager/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/yarn/server/resourcemanager/webapp/NodeIDsInfo.java
* (edit) hadoop-yarn-project/hadoop-yarn/hadoop-yarn-server/hadoop-yarn-server-resourcemanager/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/yarn/server/resourcemanager/webapp/dao/LabelsToNodesInfo.java
Thanks [~sunilg] for reviewing/committing and [~giovanni.fumarola] for identifying and fixing the issue!

[~sunilg]
This issue is valid for 2.8 too. So i think we should merge to 2.8 too
